headline: Disney CFO 'comfortable' with theme park price hikes, warns of 'negative' impact from Universal's Epic Universe
summary: Disney said the consumer "seems to be doing fine" as investors monitor signs of a potential slowdown in the company's theme parks business.

headline: The Rise and Fall and Rise of Disney Stock in 2024
summary: This year has had its ups and downs for the House of Mouse, but the company is finally putting it all together heading into 2025.

headline: Disney is doubling its fleet of cruise ships. Here's why
summary: Disney (DIS) recently unveiled its newest cruise ship, the 1,119-foot-long Disney Treasure, in New York City this November. It is just the first ship of several in a huge expansion of the budding yet lucrative business for the media giant.

headline: Warner and Comcast Resolve ‘Harry Potter’ Dispute in New Distribution Pact
summary: They finalized a cable distribution deal in which Warner locks in higher fees for its networks and resolves a legal battle over a new “Harry Potter” TV series.

headline: Netflix, Disney, Hulu, and other streamers ranked by how similar they are to cable
summary: When Netflix (NFLX) debuted its streaming service in 2011, it transformed how we watched TV, offering thousands of movies and shows on demand, completely ad-free, for just $7.99 a month. The streaming revolution, ushered in by Netflix, disrupted the traditional TV business model and promised the end of cable.
